metadata.description: Canonical governance rule catalog used for policy and drift checks.

rules.statement: Follow startup read order and run session preflight before non-trivial implementation.
Use `.agents-config/docs/CONTEXT_INDEX.json` as the machine-readable map for context lookup.
Maintain canonical machine-readable execution queue in `.agents/EXECUTION_QUEUE.json`.
Plan all execution work into queue entries before changing any entry to active execution state.
Use `.agents/EXECUTION_QUEUE.json` as the only queue/scope authority across orchestrator and subagents.
Read only queue fields/items relevant to the active feature/item scope to preserve context efficiency.
Move completed task/feature work from hot queue into feature-sharded archive artifacts.

Maintain machine-readable plan lifecycle + authoritative narrative context (including enforced pre-spec purpose/non-goals fields) in `PLAN.json` for each active/deferred/archived feature plan directory.
Require at least one concrete reference in every `PLAN.json` implementation step.
Require non-empty `narrative.pre_spec_outline.non_goals` for policy-configured plan statuses (default: `ready`, `deferred`).
Forbid placeholder implementation-step deliverables using policy deny patterns.
For complete implementation steps, require non-empty completion-summary arrays for delivered work, touched files/functions/hooks, and verification/testing.
Enforce policy-driven coherence between top-level plan status and implementation-step statuses.
Keep changes narrowly scoped unless the user explicitly requests broad refactors.
Use machine-readable contracts as authority with concise human nuance addenda when needed.
When process expectations change, update policy + enforcement + human docs together.
Read and maintain `.agents/CONTINUITY.md` as canonical continuity context.
Treat compaction recovery as full startup and run preflight.
Require preflight index readiness checks (always re-index, then strict verify) before implementation starts.
Keep `.agents-config/docs/CONTEXT_INDEX.json` synchronized with policy/documentation contracts and fail checks on drift.
Maintain canonical rule IDs/statements in `.agents-config/contracts/rules/canonical-ruleset.json` with hash lineage tied to policy and rules docs.
Allow local-only override IDs only through `.agents-config/agent-overrides/rule-overrides.json`, validated against `.agents-config/agent-overrides/rule-overrides.schema.json`.
Permit managed-file override payloads only for explicitly allowlisted entries (`allow_override=true`) and fail unknown `.agents-config/agent-overrides/**` payload files.

Keep managed workflow manifests (`.agents-config/agent-managed.json` and `.agents-config/tools/bootstrap/managed-files.template.json`) canonical with explicit `canonical_contract` defaults and authority modes.

Treat `.agents` as the canonical project-local agent-context path; bootstrap defaults to external workfiles mode where `.agents` symlinks to `<agents-workfiles-path>/<project-id>` (default path `../agents-workfiles`), and local `.agents` mode is explicit via `--agents-mode local`.
Keep all non-primary Git worktrees under `../<repo-name>.worktrees`.
`.agents/**` is shared multi-session state; every `.agents/**` edit must be semantically merged against latest on-disk state.
Prefer true TDD and document deviations when strict TDD is impractical.
Treat 100% coverage as default bar unless user-approved exception exists.
Explicitly map outcomes to all in-scope user requests before closeout.
Maintain `.agents-config/docs/FEATURE_INDEX.json` as the canonical machine-readable feature map.
Maintain `.agents-config/docs/TEST_MATRIX.md` as the canonical targeted test-command matrix.
Enforce canonical release-notes template + generator workflow, section order, and plain-English non-jargon summaries through policy checks.
Treat `CHANGELOG.md` as release-notes source of truth and rotate `Unreleased` during `release:prepare`.
Maintain `.agents-config/docs/LOGGING_STANDARDS.md` and enforce logging compliance checks across frontend/backend/python runtime code.
Use a hybrid instruction contract: machine-readable payload plus concise human-readable intent/nuance.
Keep delegated work and resulting diffs tightly scoped to the user request; no overbroad refactors unless explicitly requested.
Treat the machine-readable payload as authoritative for execution; resolve conflicts with prose before proceeding.
Preserve orchestrator context by delegating substantive implementation/investigation tasks whenever delegation is available.
All non-trivial work must be delegated to subagents; direct single-agent execution is restricted to trivial tasks.
Treat subagent delegation for non-trivial work as mandatory and non-optional to preserve orchestrator context budget.
When nuances are not fully captured by machine-readable fields, include concise human-language addenda.
Delegate work in atomic task slices so each subagent context remains narrow and auditable.
Require subagent output in two channels: machine-readable result envelope plus concise human-readable summary.
Limit orchestrator direct execution to coordination/meta tasks; if delegation is infeasible, record explicit rationale first.
Release idle subagents as soon as they are no longer actively executing delegated work.
Default subagent orchestration mapping is Codex agents via `codex` CLI and Claude agents via `claude` CLI unless user-overridden.
Mark unknowns explicitly as `UNCONFIRMED` and fail fast on missing required fields.
Each delegated subagent task must target exactly one concrete objective with explicit atomic_scope boundaries; split multi-objective requests into separate tasks.
Use exactly one orchestrator context owner per session; subagents execute delegated work and must not recursively orchestrate.
Keep subagent machine payloads and human addenda concise, bounded by configured verbosity budgets.
Apply concise verbosity budgets across spec outline, refined spec, and detailed implementation plan artifacts.

Default model routing is role/risk-based: orchestrator uses `gpt-5.3-codex` with `xhigh`, subagents use `gpt-5.3-codex` with `high`, and Spark is reserved for low-risk loops with explicit verification commands.
Maintain `.agents-config/docs/ROUTE_MAP.md` as the canonical generated backend/frontend route map.
Maintain per-domain start-here READMEs in `backend/src/routes`, `backend/src/services`, and `frontend/features/*`.
Maintain `.agents-config/docs/JSDOC_COVERAGE.md` as the generated exported-symbol documentation drift tracker.
